documentation.text:
@dev By sending Ether and staking the Ether sent for a duration (seconds), you can receive tokens.
 Emits a {TokenPurchase} event.

@dev By sending the amount of paytoken and staking the Ether sent during the duration (seconds), you can receive the token.
 Emits a {TokenPurchase} event.

@dev You can withdraw the staked ether or paytoken.
 Emits a {Withdraw} event.

@dev You can receive tokens by staking again for a period (seconds) without withdrawal.
 Emits a {TokenRePurchase} event.
@dev You can see the amount the user can withdraw.

When the FLD is mined by sending the erc20 token amount for a period of time,
 it returns true if the FLD can be obtained(mined).

When the FLD is mined by sending the ether amount for a period of time,
 it returns true if the FLD can be obtained(mined).
Returns true if it is a miningable period.

Calculate the mining rate when locked during the period.
 Depending on the type of mining, it is calculated at a linear rate over time,
 or at a fixed rate for each specific period unit.

When the amount is locked for a period, the amount of mining is calculated.
 Depending on the type of mining, it is calculated at a linear rate over time,
 or at a fixed rate for each specific period unit.
@dev You can view the current lock storage of your account.
the current lock storage length of your account.
You can view the lock storage of array index of your account.

When calculating the mining rate with the mining period,
 this value is used as the unit period
 if the method of calculating the ratio over time is used.

When only Ether is sent, the mining period is set to this value.
 When creating a contract, this value is set as the end time-start time.

attributes.text:
@dev By sending Ether and staking the Ether sent for a duration (seconds), you can receive tokens.
 Emits a {TokenPurchase} event.

@dev By sending the amount of paytoken and staking the Ether sent during the duration (seconds), you can receive the token.
 Emits a {TokenPurchase} event.

@dev You can withdraw the staked ether or paytoken.
 Emits a {Withdraw} event.

@dev You can receive tokens by staking again for a period (seconds) without withdrawal.
 Emits a {TokenRePurchase} event.
@dev You can see the amount the user can withdraw.

When the FLD is mined by sending the erc20 token amount for a period of time,
 it returns true if the FLD can be obtained(mined).

When the FLD is mined by sending the ether amount for a period of time,
 it returns true if the FLD can be obtained(mined).
Returns true if it is a miningable period.

Calculate the mining rate when locked during the period.
 Depending on the type of mining, it is calculated at a linear rate over time,
 or at a fixed rate for each specific period unit.

When the amount is locked for a period, the amount of mining is calculated.
 Depending on the type of mining, it is calculated at a linear rate over time,
 or at a fixed rate for each specific period unit.
@dev You can view the current lock storage of your account.
the current lock storage length of your account.
You can view the lock storage of array index of your account.

When calculating the mining rate with the mining period,
 this value is used as the unit period
 if the method of calculating the ratio over time is used.

When only Ether is sent, the mining period is set to this value.
 When creating a contract, this value is set as the end time-start time.

buyToken(uint256).details: By sending Ether and staking the Ether sent for a duration (seconds), you can receive tokens. Emits a {TokenPurchase} event.

buyTokens(address,uint256,uint256).details: By sending the amount of paytoken and staking the Ether sent during the duration (seconds), you can receive the token. Emits a {TokenPurchase} event.

canWithdrawAmount(address).details: You can see the amount the user can withdraw.

getAllUserLocks(address).details: You can view the current lock storage of your account.

rebuyToken(uint256).details: You can receive tokens by staking again for a period (seconds) without withdrawal. Emits a {TokenRePurchase} event.

withdraw().details: You can withdraw the staked ether or paytoken. Emits a {Withdraw} event.

calculateAmountByRatio(uint256,uint256).notice: When the amount is locked for a period, the amount of mining is calculated. Depending on the type of mining, it is calculated at a linear rate over time, or at a fixed rate for each specific period unit.

defaultDuration().notice: When only Ether is sent, the mining period is set to this value. When creating a contract, this value is set as the end time-start time.

getRatio(uint256).notice: Calculate the mining rate when locked during the period. Depending on the type of mining, it is calculated at a linear rate over time, or at a fixed rate for each specific period unit.

getUserLocks(address,uint256).notice: You can view the lock storage of array index of your account.

lengthAllUserLocks(address).notice: the current lock storage length of your account.

uintMiningPeriods().notice: When calculating the mining rate with the mining period, this value is used as the unit period if the method of calculating the ratio over time is used.

validPeriod(uint256).notice: Returns true if it is a miningable period.

validPurchase(uint256,uint256).notice: When the FLD is mined by sending the erc20 token amount for a period of time, it returns true if the FLD can be obtained(mined).

validPurchaseETH(uint256,uint256).notice: When the FLD is mined by sending the ether amount for a period of time, it returns true if the FLD can be obtained(mined).
